channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Senate eyes key vote on Trump’s tax bill, while Musk calls it ‘utterly insane and destructive’
item.description: Not all GOP lawmakers are on board with proposals to reduce spending on Medicaid, food stamps and other programs to help cover the cost of tax cuts.

item.title: Chief Justice Roberts warns against elected officials’ heated political words about judges
item.description: Without identifying anyone by name, Roberts clearly referenced Republican President Donald Trump and Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer.

item.title: Falling home prices are raising the risk of a deeper correction as the housing market cracks under high mortgage rates
item.description: The latest Case-Shiller home price report showed a 0.3% monthly fall in the 20-city index in April, steeper than March's downwardly revised 0.2% dip.

item.title: A shadow Fed chief could lead to a ‘revolt’ on the FOMC against Powell’s successor, former vice chair warns
item.description: "If he or she contradicts what Powell is saying, that will aggravate the FOMC, almost all of whose members will still be there when the new chair take...

item.title: Two workers for SEC’s EDGAR system charged with insider trading
item.description: Prosecutors alleged they pocketed $1 million by stealing non-public information obtained through their jobs.

item.title: AI could wipe out entire Wall Street teams. Here’s who will have staying power.
Will ‘F1’ help Apple finally win one in the movie and streaming race?
Can a baby bonus really make Americans have more kids? What big families say.
Tech stocks are powering a record-setting Wall Street rally—but for how long?
Trump’s latest trade threat looms over Wall Street as stocks return to records
